task.summary: Default task
Made some rearrangements in phphstorm, the new files are just it's workspace
Task 2 finished That was a wacky experience, though, i think, i got the hang of them arrays
Task 3 finished The one with the star, though, was by far the easiest

Task 4 finished So, the hardest part turned out to be Task 2, cuz i never actually got to finish it propery - didn't even work our for me the way it was supposed to
I did find some wacky functions on stackoverflow of how to properly copy arrays and objects, when it comes to that, but it was nothing near to what was shown to us during the class

Removed everything from master branch as I forgot to do it form the start
again
Moved HW3 to according folder
Prepared workspace for HW4

Finished Task 1 It was a pain, i was trying to put everything in return object right away without creating unnecessary variables, but failed miserably In the end I didn't quite get how do I reference the variables within the very same object during a single initialisation (im not even sure if it's possible at all) so there you got, a peg I came up with Aint top efficient, but hey, as long as it woks (˵¯͒⌄¯͒˵)

Finished Task 2 Finally, god, it was terrible Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed every second of it, nothing pushed me to work harder as much as bugs in my code do There were a couple of bugs which I couldn't really track, so I've spent at least an hour to do that and to fix it all If only you had seem my face when I saw the code running as intended ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) I also did it a bit different from what you've asked from us in the hw.pdf, but I guess it works just as fine with random items in the cart as if it did with <double even> numbers Talking about task 3, I didn't really want to do it cuz i remember myself making the very same thing back in the school days, but in Pascal. I wanted to send you the .exe of that game, but unfortunately, as it turns out, i hadn't saved it when reinstalling my windows this summer :c Anyway, there you go °˖✧◝(⁰▿⁰)◜✧˖°
Got workspace ready for HW 5 Also deleter .idea from repository as there was literally no need for it being there in the first place

Finished Task 1 Also made the table extendable upto alphabetical limit (26x26) running by default with random size function, but there is a commenter-out 8x8 grid as well Additionally added some plain text to <readme> file as it seemed to be lonely on the repository page

Finished Task 2 I really didn't feel like using stylesheet for the table so I inserted all the styles directly into the html Yeah, it may be messy if one reads into the html, but hey, im happy enough, so that just about does it for me for now

0.7
Made some adjustments to .css, now displays <Settings> and <Score> fine
In game.init() moved #menu and #game into one div so as to center the menu buttons right beneath the game grid
Finished render.score() function, updates upon having eaten

0.8
.popup-window no longer have borders .wall cells are now filled with gray
Snake now successfully bumps into 'wall' cells and into itself, resulting in game over
Walls are now and object with it's own <render.walls()> Snake detects them as obstacles and stops

0.9
Removed all <game> references as there were literally no need for that, all the objects are within the very save .js file It's a bit day, boys, we actually did it I've been wanting to do that from the very beginning as i thought it was wrong to do si, and turns out i was right
#game grid is now properly centered, even when it's smaller size (e.g. 11x11)
In <render.settings()> replaced (+) and (-) td's with actual buttons, so that now you can't select plus or minus That has been bugging me for quite some time now
Changed all on-screen text into Russian

1.0
The snake is now somewhat winnable
Fixed minor bugs in config.validate() function that wouldn't allow for MIN or MAX values to pass through
Glued the snake grid to the screen center

1.1
Changed <walls> to <wall> object, as it is much more comfortable to call Walls now clear on game initiation
eatWall config is not added as a checkbox to <settings> window The check is kept through new game initiation When checked, the snake will leave walls on cells where food was eaten The function is located in <snake.move()>

1.2
Added "Apply" button to <settings> window that calls game.init()
Fixed but with render.settings() always falling one point behind Fixed bug with ghost buttons being clickable, also moved them on z-axis down 10 layers, so as to prevent it from blocking cells when hovering in search of sigil Fixed some typos
Added Nazi mode Nazi sigil generates randomly but stays hidden unless you hover over it Once the snake's tail, which is longer than 1, touches the tle, it turns black and turns into a wall During this time the snake stops so as to fill all the nazi cells

1.3
Minor typos Changed page title to "Snake"
The screen now gradually goes red upon Nazi win condition In Nazi-mode Score now displays % of tiles filled
Added fillAll() function to <nazi> object for debugging purposes
Added Debug popup-window to the right side, toggleable Popup-windows now have titles

1.3.1
Now the screen both shakes and turns red upon Nazi win condition
It this point, everything is done, just need to perform a total cleanup for the core (which is a total mess at this point and reminds me more of spaghetti)

1.3.2
minor fixes to css in render.naziScreen() function

again

Prepared workspace for HW4

Finished Task 1 It was a pain, i was trying to put everything in return object right away without creating unnecessary variables, but failed miserably In the end I didn't quite get how do I reference the variables within the very same object during a single initialisation (im not even sure if it's possible at all) so there you got, a peg I came up with Aint top efficient, but hey, as long as it woks (˵¯͒⌄¯͒˵)
P.S. I just realised that this could have been done even easier - I could have first checked for the number to be less than 999, then convert it to String and then just extract 0, 1 and 2 char position (❁°͈▵°͈)

Finished Task 2 Finally, god, it was terrible Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed every second of it, nothing pushed me to work harder as much as bugs in my code do There were a couple of bugs which I couldn't really track, so I've spent at least an hour to do that and to fix it all If only you had seem my face when I saw the code running as intended ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) I also did it a bit different from what you've asked from us in the hw.pdf, but I guess it works just as fine with random items in the cart as if it did with <double even> numbers Talking about task 3, I didn't really want to do it cuz i remember myself making the very same thing back in the school days, but in Pascal. I wanted to send you the .exe of that game, but unfortunately, as it turns out, i hadn't saved it when reinstalling my windows this summer :c Anyway, there you go °˖✧◝(⁰▿⁰)◜✧˖°
